website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you stand on your feet all day, but may be too constrictive for some activities and larger individuals.
pros: Provides comfort for most all-day wearers
cons: Fit is a bit tight and  on the long side
The fit tends to get even tighter after washing

customer_reviews.title: Great for Newbies
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of compression socks. So far, they're holding up well. Be sure to use the provided instructions to put them on, and hand wash in cold water only. I use them to run; enjoy the extra support they provide. For reference, I am 6'0", 150 pounds, wear a size 10 women's shoe and purchased the S/M size which seems to fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Miller

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how anyone rated these above one star. I guess they get a star for comfort. I have used several other brands ordered on Amazon and all have been good. But these literally ripped to shreds when I pulled them on the very first time. At first I thought it was a fluke with one sock, it wasn't. Both socks socks shredded. They are terrible and the manufacturer has to know. Poor product.
customer_reviews.author: AB77

customer_reviews.title: Definitely no "100% guarantee"
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 different pair of compression socks from Amazon at the same time. The 100% satisfaction guarantee made it seem like a low risk move to give these socks a try. Upon wearing them, they would stay nice and tight for a little bit, but then fall down gradually and would never stay up unlike the other socks I got. Disappointed by this, I tried contacted Blitzu through their site. No response. Sent them a Facebook message. No response. So much for their backing behind their "satisfaction guarantee" and their sense of customer service. Never again. I much prefer Vitalsox here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great the first time
customer_reviews.text: I only wore and wash them once before this happened. I'm really disappointed because I really enjoyed these and had intended on switching to the Blitzu brand. If the pulling hadn't happened, I would have given it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: ToddlersMom

customer_reviews.title: Seriously unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product as it looked, from the descriptions to be a knee high, over the calf sock. Even went so far to get the large/xlarge to be safe. Well I can guarentee they are not only NOT knee high/over-the-calf, but the quality is shit. They go about half-way up my calf and while pulling them uo, my finger punched a hole through the sock. Never had this issue with futuro, but apparently blitzu doesn't have the same high standards
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: A disaster for the toes.  Try something else.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pair to get more than a single day's use experience. I am a size 12 so I ordered L/XL. Blitzu were a little short and didn't rise up the calf more than half. They did OK compression from the heel upward but they seemed to have virtually NO compression in the toe/foot area. Not good especially as the day wore on. They acted almost like a compression sleeve instead and pushed fluid above and below. After using all day they appear to have pushed fluid down into the toes and the toes were more swollen than ever. I will NOT be purchasing more and I will order more of my FitShit branded compression socks.
customer_reviews.author: Chernabog

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable for a few hours but after a while the ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for long overseas flights. The socks are made from high quality materials and compress as described. For me, they are comfortable for a few hours but after a while the constriction becomes overwhelming and need to be taken off. I ordered the appropriate size for my feet. I suspect using these for sports activities will be very effective at keeping the feet and calf warm or would work well for recovery after strenuous running/sprinting. For airplanes, I would give these a pass and just stick with making sure you get up and walk around as well as do regular in-seat leg exercises to prevent swelling/clots/DVT.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I have lymphedema so need to wear stockings daily. The compression on these aren't as tight as I'm supposed to wear but they're so much more comfortable than my nylon tan ones! I put them on and immediately ordered another pair. They're super comfortable and they fit perfectly. I have very short legs and these were the perfect height. I was worried about them being too tight on my calves, because of my swelling, but this was not the case! Highly recommend! They seem like great quality and feel so nice compared to others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: ncolson

customer_reviews.title: Not great for short people
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and easy to pull up as far as compression socks go, but they are a little long for me. I'm 5'4 and these hit my knees. In order for them to come up to just below my knee I have to carefully not pull them up hard, but still pull them up uniformly because having a wrinkle or extra fabric in one place quickly becomes uncomfortable. I also ordered these: BLITZU Air Travel Compression Socks 20-30mmHg for Men & Women Best Recovery Performance Stockings for Medical Athletic Edema Diabetic Varicose Veins Pregnancy Relief Shin Splints, which are cheaper, very comfortable, and are a better length for me but don't have the extra ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: Allison H.

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings about these
customer_reviews.text: As noted in other reviews these are difficult to put on, and the proper procedure is not found on the packaging. These are about half the length of other compression socks and stretch to full size. You need strong hands and fingers to work these into position. There is a lot of excess material on the inside of the socks and these make compression marks on your legs and feet. The compression is strong and they look great when you have them on.
customer_reviews.author: R. U.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 different kinds to see which I liked best for playing tennis. These were one of the best ones. Very happy with their compression, sizing and durability. Very similar to the WAVE brand in those qualities, but I did like the color and style of these a tad better. These were WAY better than the Copper Compression ones, which I ended up returning because their quality was so much lower than the others. I also bought a pair of calf sleeves which were of good quality, but I found out that my ankles still swell some with the sleeves, so these are better for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: MA_buyer

customer_reviews.title: Sox rock!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my socks for a full week of work, I LOVE them! It is like someone hugging my legs all day. They are comfortable and look awesome, I got the purple ones! Will be wearing these from now on, with everything. I gave all my other socks to my daughter and will be buying more of these a couple pairs at a time. Well worth the cost, the edema in my legs is gone. No more divits, no swelling, no sock marks where it looks like I had rubber bands on. I am on my feet and walking 7-10 miles a day outside, these wick away the moisture and keep my legs from sweating.
customer_reviews.author: Charmedmom 162271

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: As a first time user of compression socks I was amazed at how well they worked. The compression on my calve muscles was immediate and alleviated the discomfort I had. I will certainly continue to use this product in the future. After Prolonged Use: I have now used this and other compression socks (two other manufacturers) for two months and when I recently purchased another pair my choice was unhesitatingly BLITZU. I have found that their compression is the firmest by far and really gives a wonderful feeling of support. I would highly recommend this compression sock to anyone involved in running or walking.
customer_reviews.author: Swerving

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on plane and more!
customer_reviews.text: I'd purchased two pairs of socks for my trip across the country and were amazed at how well these worked out! I'd also purchased PowerLix socks, which were inferior in sizing, fit, and durability. The Blitzu socks were incredible and held up in a multi-hour flight with layovers, massaged my legs as I walked 8 miles+ a day, and barely showed any wear! After two weeks of continuous wear, the Blitzu socks endured. And what's more...after I got back I had LESS overall pain in my feet and legs than ever! Now I barely need to wear these kind of socks at all. If I do end up buying compression socks again, this brand is definitely my go-to!
customer_reviews.author: D. Paz

customer_reviews.title: Great socks, stop the kankle nonsense!
customer_reviews.text: I am in the medical field and after 25 yrs of work, my lower legs are starting to just plain wear out! The support hose are a little thick, which concerned me at first in the south FL heat and humidity. However, that has not been an issue. They are working better than the 'traditional' tan support socks that I have used in the past. Plus, the crazy color is more 'youthful' than the tan stocks that made me feel like I was practicing for a retirement home! The informational photos on how to put on the socks was helpful, also. I just wish they had other interesting colors like neon green or yellow or blue.....
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great and reasonable compression socks!
customer_reviews.text: I have venous insufficiency which causes some foot and ankle swelling. My doctor told me to wear compression socks and I now own 5 different brands, as I'm always looking for better ones. Blitzu was the last brand I bought and will be the last I try, because these socks work great and the price was reasonable. When my other ones need to be replaced, I will definitely get more Blitzu. The only downside is they are a little harder to put on than others unless you follow the instructions that the company sends. But the results are well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B. Guttman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am recovering from a serious DVT event. Currently, I am dealing with one remaining clot behind my left knee. It is still causing severe swelling in the lower ankle area. The tendons surrounding the ankle joint are inflamed and making walking a difficult chore. Once I got the go ahead from my doctor to use compression stockings I selected your product, one that met the compression range and price performance. After I learned how to put them on, thanks to your tutorial, the stockings have provided near normal mobility. The reinforcement the stocking give to the tendons is remarkable as well as the reduction in swelling.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Coffield

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for my long runs
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'9", 150lbs, size 11 shoe and the sm/med fit me PERFECTLY. I was surprised because I never wear anything small/med. The compression felt so good and allowed me to run that extra mile. I only gave 4 stars because if you aren't careful, the sock can easily tear in between the compression ribs. I tore a small hole in the sock with my fingernail when I put them on for the second time. The seller immediately sent me a replacement pair & customer service was exceptional. Highly recommend these affordable socks, just be careful if you have any length of fingernails!
customer_reviews.author: Lucysmom

customer_reviews.title: NOT 20-30mmHG as stated
customer_reviews.text: These may be compression socks, but they are. I've been wearing compression socks for a LONG time and these barely can qualify as compression socks. They have a tighter feel than normal socks, but don't advertise as 20-30mmHG when they are clearly not.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Get all the pairs!!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several different compression socks and these were my favorite ones. I stand at work 8-12 hours straight and my feet were so achy lately after only 2/3 hours. I wore these socks as soon as I got them and they changed everything! My feet don’t hurt at all anymore! (And if they begin to get a little achy it isn’t until my last hour or so). I ordered 3 more to have a pair every day. They are a little tight on top...I bruise easily and I often have a little bruise but I still love these. I wear a size 8 1/2 women’s and I got the medium.
customer_reviews.author: Nidia

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but quality in question!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with compression socks. They do seem to be helping the swelling in my feet. However I am concerned about the quality of the stitching of the socks. On the inside there are many loose threads, some with loops, that I catch my toes in when putting on the socks. I have been reluctant to cut the threads for fear it will cause the socks to run. I have not found a way to cobtact the manufacturer to see if it is OK to cut the loops. I definitely need more than one pair but am reluctant to order more that may have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G

customer_reviews.title: Great Support / Tape Alternative
customer_reviews.text: I have PTTD(Posterior tibial tendon dysfunction) and have been figuring out how to run with it for over a year now. At first I had to tape but I was burning through tape so I looked for an alternative solution. These compression socks offered the support I was looking for and I didn't have to break the bank to get them. Pros: - Great support for foot and ankle injury recovery - Quality construction (lasted me a year of marathon training and still in good condition) - Price Cons: - According to care instructions, need to be hand washed and air dried (I haven't tested in a machine)
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Great socks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a lot of different things from Amazon over the years and I have to say I have never, ever, had follow-up from a company like Kevin and Blitzu! I bought these stockings specifically for a long plane ride. I showed them to my doctor who said wear them whenever I need to be sitting for any length of time, I specially appreciated the detailed instructions (yes I know they are only socks), but they do require some special fitting to make them feel good. So, I recommend these socks and this company and Kevin highly and will be back for the rest of the colors. And, yes, Kevin please do hug a kitten!
customer_reviews.author: barbara casabar

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Although the product seems well made, it is too short. The sock is several inches too short and does not completely cover my calf as depicted in the photos. I'm 6' tall and these socks seem made for a much shorter person. They felt uncomfortable after wearing them for a few hours as the top of the sock was pressing around the largest area of my calf. I ordered the largest size available so unless they were mis-packaged I would say these are not as advertised. Also they require hand washing, which I must have missed in the original description. All the other socks I buy can be machine washed. I will not be buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: CaptanKirk

customer_reviews.title: These socks have the same level of support as the ones provided by the hospital and are very comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these due to post operative edema in my lower legs and ankles. The support stockings that they provide through the orthopedic departments just did not work out very well, (1) because of cost and (2) because they stretched out too quickly. These socks have the same level of support as the ones provided by the hospital and are very comfortable to wear. My one issue that I have, and the reason why I only gave 4 stars instead of five is durability. Pulling them up this morning the right sock tore at the top creating a hole. I hope this is not a design flaw but rather a one off occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like these socks
customer_reviews.text: I really like these socks, I have been using them when I ride my rode bike, I wish I had had them earlier I might not be dealing with blood clots. I gave them 4 stars because while trying to get them on I ended up putting a finger partially through the fabric and now have to be careful putting them on since now more susceptible to further tears..They are kind of tricky to put on, especially the first couple of times but after that you learn how to put them on and take them off with little or now effort.
customer_reviews.author: C. Buettner

customer_reviews.title: Tearing
customer_reviews.text: At first I love these sock but then I hand washed them and let them air dry. They are tearing already it hasnt been a month. THey are very comfortable, warm and fit perfectly. Thats what i love the most although they formed a hole on both sides I still like them just wish they werent tearing hasnt even been a month.
customer_reviews.author: Candygirl19

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for what I was looking for. The socks are a little tight to get on but with the instructions it makes it a little easier. That is why I gave it a 4 versus a 5 score. for someone that can't put a lot of energy into pulling these sock on they would not be able to use them. I have a EE shoe width so my feet are wider than most so it made it even harder for me to get them on. However, with that being said, once they are on they are wonderful. My feet feel great and the swelling is almost totally eliminated.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Mann

customer_reviews.title: Bought for neuropathy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping they would help my neuropathy pain in my lower legs and feet, which I sustained from a back injury 17 years ago. My left leg is much more painful than the right. Unfortunately they have not helped the pain in my left leg, it actually feels worse. But the socks do make my right leg feel good. According to my EMG test, my neuropathy is actually worse in right leg, i just dont feel the pain. I tend to trip, stub my toes and fall alot. Wounds take longer to heal than elsewhere on my body, These socks should help improve the circulation to my lower legs.
customer_reviews.author: lovemydog

customer_reviews.title: Mostly comfortable, slightly itchy and warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a long international flight. My feet and ankles have been prone to small amounts of swelling as well as a bit clammy when they get cold. I found these socks pretty darn comfortable after wearing them for over 12 hours, but they were slightly itchy at the top just under my knees. They did a great job at keeping my feet from swelling or getting clammy. In fact, they were warm. I'm not sure I would ever wear them to work out in; I fear they wouldn't stay up in place and they would be very hot. But for long periods of sitting like planes and car rides, I recommend a pair!
customer_reviews.author: rcg

customer_reviews.title: Buy from a dr
customer_reviews.text: These were ok but the ones I bought for $10 from my cardiologist were way better. I’m 32 Weeks pregnant and these just couldn’t get on anymore I cut them off the last time I wore them. I stand all day as I work in healthcare. I had to get the ones from my dr and am having excellent results with no swelling and although my feet hurt I have no new vericose veins even during pregnancy when wearing the ones from dr. My suggestion is pass on these and get a pair from a dr
customer_reviews.author: Madiloulynn

customer_reviews.title: He is very pleased with the socks
customer_reviews.text: I didn't purchase the compression knee high socks for myself but for my Dad. He is very pleased with the socks. They are quite snug, but very comfortable and felt great on his legs, ankles and feet. Anyone who has tried to put on compression socks knows that it is not easy. Thank you, Blitzu, for the email showing how to correctly put on the compression socks. It was clearly explained and made the whole process quite simple and easy. The compression socks are very well made and are of high quality. I am so pleased that I plan on ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: colorsofautumn

customer_reviews.title: My favorite brand of compression sock
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several brands of compression socks; these are my favorite. They maintain their pressure use after use, whereas some of the other brands get a little lax after several washings. They are comfortable all day; the top does not dig in over time. The footbed does not bother me at all. Some compression socks can cause blisters and/or hot sweaty feet, but these stay perfectly comfortable. My only complaint is that they do snag fairly easily on the inside; I have to take my wedding ring off to put these on. I wash them in the cold cycle inside of a garment bag, and hang them up to dry. They've stayed in great shape!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Working in the medical field on my feet all shift I have been through my gamut of support hose over the years. But these support hose are The Best!!! They are easier to get on than they look and despite the thickness (which by itself is a really good support feature). However most of all, they do not cut my circulation off below the knees or pinch my skin!!! Huge plus there! They are also great for working out at the gym and after swimming aerobics. Just ordered two more pair (and the color choices are a treat). Thanks So Much!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Maxin

customer_reviews.title: Seems unfinished and not durable.
customer_reviews.text: These are very tight for being X/XL. I have some bad circulation in one leg, and if it's swells a little I have a hard time getting it over my calf. The other leg it just falls off eventually. The inside of the socks seem very unfinished with threads just all over. Sometimes my pinkie toe has caught on them and I have to pull them off and try again. They didn't last long either. One of them have started to tear and come apart in some areas. I will probably try another brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems

customer_reviews.title: Great for pregnancy/swollen legs/vericose vein pain
customer_reviews.text: These socks are really great. I don't often write reviews, but am back on Amazon to order more of these, so figured the review was in order. I am pregnant and dealing with painful vericose veins on one leg. When I don't wear the compression socks for a day, my leg is swollen and throbbing. When I do wear them, I don't feel the pain at all, I feel snug in my socks, and and my legs aren't swollen. I bought an off-brand of compression socks at TJ Maxx, and while they are helpful, they don't offer nearly the same support as the Blitzu. Definitely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Made my first half marathon much better!
customer_reviews.text: Once i started using these for my runs, my soreness and recovery time decreased. I also just ran my first 10k, and I've only had these for a week, but I beat my personal record by 13 minutes. I like the quality,and they feel great. I'll be getting another pair! Also, I have a pair of compression sleeves. They're almost as good but I prefer the sock for comfort and making sure my ankle, Achilles, and foot is being compressed. UPDATE: just ran a half marathon in these and still loving them. I recommend getting 2 pairs so you have a clean pair post run.
customer_reviews.author: Rian

customer_reviews.title: I even feel like I have more energy after wearing these
customer_reviews.text: Work well, I work on my feet for 10-12 hours at a time and these have greatly reduced if not eliminated foot, leg, and back pain from these shifts. I even feel like I have more energy after wearing these. They are difficult to get on but well worth it, I mean the point is to be tight. The toe is a little looser than expected but it doesn't bother me or feel uncomfortable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Customer K

customer_reviews.title: Back to jogging
customer_reviews.text: My Blitzu socks arrived on Friday, as the email declared! Over the past two years, my legs have continued to be sore. Work-related, the soreness has impacted my exercise -- I don't jog hardly at all anymore -- and to feel fatigue in your legs while walking up steps is a bummer. They are thick and substantial, which I like. And more tricky to take off than put on, but it is worth it. I have worked three nights in these socks and have already noticed a difference. I don't feel ancient the following morning--big plus! I hope to return to jogging again! THANKS for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Rock

customer_reviews.title: Sizing NOT correct!
customer_reviews.text: I have neuropathy & my legs swell frequently. I normally wear a size 9. Bought these because they were priced a lot cheaper than most. I put these on myself with GREAT DIFFICULTY & my legs were NOT swollen!! I have little chicken legs & my husband struggled to get them off of me so obviously if my legs were swollen AT ALL there is NO WAY I’d be able to get them on.....😕 Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey B.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair as I'm pregnant and on my feet all day as health care provider. Never did I think I would want them on as I hate putting them on for my patients! Love them. Nice socks, washed well in washer and I let them air dry. They may say hand wash but I threw them in with my white load and they came out fine. Thick socks but it's been 90 degrees here past 2 weeks in Iowa and my feet don't seem to sweat with them. They are hard to get in with a big belly but I manage :)
customer_reviews.author: S.Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I used it during a 30 hour trip ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I used it during a 30 hour trip to Bali. No swelling or achyness in my legs at all during or after the flight. As my travel companions had significant leg swelling that I could visibly see, I was grateful to have these during the trip. (They can make your legs warm so I put them on just prior to the trip or on the plane). I think any brand will work. I purchased 4 brands/styles to try and kept these as the design which has additional elastic wrapped around your foot and feels better than the competitors. As a bonus, these were cheaper. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Good compression socks
customer_reviews.text: I work as a nurse and we do a lot of walking. For 12 hours with these on my feet they do hurt less compared to not having them. I just wish they were more durable. I washed them in the washer on "delicate" setting and I feel like after 8 washes the elasticity isn't the same. It's not the manufacturers fault because it does say hand wash but life is too fast paced to be hand washing. That is why I only have it 4 stars, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: MarcoPolo

customer_reviews.title: Great for long flights
customer_reviews.text: I found these while searching for compression socks for travel and I have been very happy with my purchase so far. They were extremely comfortable during a 15 hour flight and I could see the lines on my leg where the graduated compression was built in when I took them off. I was surprised to see they had left any indentions since they were not overly tight or uncomfortable in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Cody C.

customer_reviews.title: Blitzu sells the most perfect and durable compression socks on the market!
customer_reviews.text: These compression knee socks are made of the highest quality. They are heavy duty and will last a very long time. These socks have helped me better than any other compression socks used before. I have some friends my age and have urged them to get these socks and use Blitzu as this vendor is honorable, professional and courteous. You can tell they care and the is one of the most important things you can have with a vendor. They will be my vendor for life as they have many other products that I will purchase from them in the future! Thanks so much.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wished I had these a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I can explain more of what these compression socks has done for me but just plain relief. I read the other reviews on other compression socks and they wasn't good review. I got this brand due to a nurse who recommend these brand. They come package very well and just made my life so great. I am not being paid for my review just giving you my experience with my first time using compression socks. Will buy from again.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for maternity use (and after!)
customer_reviews.text: I am currently 31 weeks pregnant and dealing with some swelling in my feet ( I sit at a desk all day) so my doctor suggested getting some compression socks. After tons of research and reading reviews, I finally decided on this pair. I'm happy to report that they aren't too tight, aren't incredibly hard to put on, and most importantly they do the job. I wear a shoe size 8 and got the S/M and they fit perfectly. I could also see myself wearing these after I have the baby when going for a run. Also, these socks aren't terribly thick which is nice. For the price and quality of sock, I don't think you will go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 1 pair. Then ordered 2 more pair.
customer_reviews.text: These Blitzu compression socks put the spring back in my step! Follow the supplied directions for putting on the socks. If you don't follow the directions, you may never get the socks on. Reverse the directions to get the socks off. My doctor recommended I wear compression socks but I figured it would be too much trouble and they would be uncomfortable. I put off buying compression socks for over a year. Now I'm sold! Sure, putting them on and off is harder than normal socks but the benefits are worth the extra effort. I kick myself for procrastinating.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Thicker than expected
customer_reviews.text: I had tried this brand because I thought it would be similar to the others I have bought on Amazon, and I ordered down a size from my usual M/L to a small because I have recently lost weight, so my legs are a bit smaller and I wanted a tighter compression. These are almost equal to the other brand M/L, and thicker and softer in weight. They'd be nice socks for the winter, and comfortable but as far as compression goes I didn't feel it. My legs aren't very thin either, I wouldn't normally consider myself a small in anything.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bei

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star Blitzu compression socks
customer_reviews.text: I love the Blitzu compression socks! They fit tight so if you have developed calves get the xtra-large, if you have sze 13-14 calves get large. I got the large and I have slender ankles and calves. Fold the socks over the foot part of the sock, make sure the V points to the front of toes (lined up) and grab the ankle of sock onto foot until toes are snug in the sock and pull up over your heel.Grab the folded sock up your leg ,pulling firmly until you have no more fold and you reached your knee. Voila! Now you can walk, garden, stand at a job all day, or shop with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalind

customer_reviews.title: BUT it is a very comfortable sock. Fabric is soft
customer_reviews.text: I'M 5ft 8in tall and wear a 10 shoe, but I bought the L/Xl because I had other same sized compression socks in the past. These may be a little large for me, BUT it is a very comfortable sock. Fabric is soft, thick, and easy to put on. Because it is slightly large , it probably is only 20 mm pressure, but i'll trade the above for the comfort. It you have a larger shoe, it'll probably be perfect. If you're on the small side and want the 30 mm, you probably need to get the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria & O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: No edema in my lower extremities!
customer_reviews.text: First the company said: " for each review we receive we will find a public place to spontaneously dance in your honor." I think that's great and I may just buy another pair to get a second dance! The compression socks are not to snug and apply just the right amount of compression, they hold up well, I've been using them post knee surgery, the pink color is great and bright. They come with directions to apply and if you follow the directions they are very easy to apply. I will provide pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud6

customer_reviews.title: These have stayed pretty tight after a few washes
customer_reviews.text: As a nurse, working 12 hour shifts, my dogs start to hurt fairly quickly on the hard concrete and linoleum floors. These socks help a ton to postpone that hurt, and when it finally hurts it is definitely reduced from what normal ankle socks would give. I wasn't a believer until I tried compression socks. These have stayed pretty tight after a few washes, and I've been impressed. If you've never put compression socks on, read the instructions because it gives good hints how to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Simple test. Great results.
customer_reviews.text: Simply love these when working on my feet all day. I was a bit skeptical so I wore a regular wool trekking sock on one foot and a Blitzu on the other. I was more than pleasantly surprised at how much better the Blitzu leg and foot felt at the end of the day. There was a huge noticeable difference in the way my feet felt. It sold me. I doubt I will ever wear regular socks again when hiking or working. Compression socks work in a big way and Blitzu's are crazy comfortable and very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is my only concern, otherwise they seem to be as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of experience with compression socks. I wear a women's size 5 shoe and am fairly short. Other than being very difficult to put on (which may be a normal thing for compression socks), these are way too tall for me. So, I recommend that you have very long legs if you expect these to com to just under your knees, without folding them over quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Great support, attractive
customer_reviews.text: I have had chronic lympedema in one leg for 20 years or so. I often use 60 mm Hg socks but sometimes I just want something that isn’t so much pressure because they are uncomfortable. These software a comfortable, breathable, and great, for working out or walking or yoga. I’’ve only purchased black so far. They don’t bleed. The other colors look fun too.
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: Give them a try! They’re worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was diagnosed with POTS (postural orthostatic tachycardia) and because of this my blood pools in my feet and legs. My cardiologist recommended wearing compression socks to help with this. Once I received these I used them and could tell the difference after only one use. I thought it was just a fluke so tried another pair and suffered awful symptoms all day. So I went back to these and felt good. If they keep my blood from pooling in my feet, I’m happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, excellent support!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three different brands of compression socks, all were highly recommended and had excellent ratings...I've worn all three to determine which I preferred and which would be the most comfortable and best fit my needs...while all three provided the support as advertised, the Blitzu socks in my opinion were the most comfortable to wear and provided excellent support...I can highly recommend these socks....Time will tell how they will hold up, but they seem very well made and I have no reason to believe they won't provide excellent service...
customer_reviews.author: sweetpea9

customer_reviews.title: it was easy. The socks worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: At first, I struggled getting the socks on my feet. After I learned the correct method, it was easy. The socks worked perfectly. edema was significantly reduced. I now only use one sock at a time as the issue is only in one leg. My feet are only size 9.5 but I ordered extra large because I have large calves. That size works best for me. BTW, the easy-on method is to put your hand through the sock and grab the heal. Pull the top ot the sock over your hand and then put the partially inside out sock on your foot. Next, slide (pull) the top of the sock over your calf.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Liked first pair enough to order second
customer_reviews.text: Searched for socks all over. Took a risk on these based off reviews and was pleasantly surprised! I also got another brand and love them too. These however are thick socks and seem to have a cushioned foot. They are a little tight at the top of calf. But I got used to them. I measure a 16, and got L/XL...package is dual labeled. If you have a bigger calf like me anything bigger than a 16 I don’t think will fit or like them.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Great help for anyone not just the old folks like me.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these when I worked as a nurse. On my feet 8-12 hours a day and getting older by the day. My legs, knees and feet would be screaming. These were the temporary answer to my prayers.then I retired (halleluja) so I don't use them as much but they will come in handy when we go for vacation (3 weeks ) with a lot of shuffling from place to place doing the tourist thing. Yeah definitely need these.
customer_reviews.author: talonmedic

customer_reviews.title: Nice durable product
customer_reviews.text: I need to wear compression socks due to edema. These socks are easier to get on, and are quite thick compared to regular TED hose. I am loving the bright pink color too. I washed them in the regular wash cycle and hung them to dry. They stiffened up a little, but that is minor and went away with wearing them. They are a great "winter weight" item, and the compression seems comparable to the medical stockings I have used in the past. These might get a little too hot for summer heat and humidity; but for winter cold, they are wonderful! I wish I had another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: I am a nurse and it is not easy to find compression socks that are comfortable all day ...
customer_reviews.text: No more tired feet or achy legs after a 12 or 16 hour shift. I am a nurse and it is not easy to find compression socks that are comfortable all day or that keep there effectiveness over time. The socks were a little tighter that other brands and the fabric is heavier, but wow- what a world of difference! The Blitzu socks are worth the extra money. The kinesiology portion is especially supportive. I have worn them on 60 degree days as well as 90 degree days and they are still comfortable. I have been so happy with them, that I am ordering another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent reader

customer_reviews.title: These have been a lifesaver! I started experiencing shin ...
customer_reviews.text: These have been a lifesaver! I started experiencing shin splints and it was getting to the point that it was keeping me from being able to run. I bought these socks along with new running shoes and I've been shin splint free! If I'm feeling sore the next day I put these on and it helps to relieve the aches and soreness dramatically! I usually wear an 8.5 and size 9 in running shoes, I ordered these socks in a size Small/medium and they fit perfectly. They are an extremely thick material and fit very tight! Which is exactly what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Toner

customer_reviews.title: Best Compression Socks I have found
customer_reviews.text: On the recommendation of my doctor following leg pain after a long-distance flight, I started using compression socks. I have tried several brands of compression socks and found them to be too tight, too loose, or too difficult to get on and off. I love the Blitzu compression socks because they fit and are easier to put on and take off. These compression socks are worth the money. I have the footless and the regular compression socks. I highly recommend these socks!
customer_reviews.author: Moonbeam95

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love almost everything about these socks, but I have one problem. They are about two or three inches too short for me - but I am exceptionally tall and this is not likely to be an issue for the vast majority of other people. I still wear them, because so far they are the best compression socks I have found and I need them for work. I just wish these came in different lengths! Update: I am changing my rating to a 5, because Blitzu does in fact make these socks in a longer length! The color scheme is different (mostly one color), and they have XL in the title. You can get buy them on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Hexa

customer_reviews.title: Check em out.
customer_reviews.text: Doctor told me to start wearing compression socks.Knowing nothing about them started reading the reviews. Liked what I read about Blitzu C. S. They came on time . At first I had a little trouble putting them on . Went back and watched the video they sent me . OK no more trouble just have to know how . Right away I felt relief from my leg pains. These are strong and very comfortable. I've never used any other brand but these work great for me. Yes I give Blitzu Compression Socks five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but on the short side!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for an upcoming long flight. They're not uncomfortable, the compression feels perfect, but they're on the shorter side. I'm 5'9" with a size 9 (women's) shoe, and the L/XL barely comes up below my knee. If I really stretch them, I can get them to the proper knee height, but I'm concerned that they might not stay there. If you have had trouble with compression socks being too long - bunching behind your knees - these will be perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: areifenb

customer_reviews.title: The circulation I needed
customer_reviews.text: I use these 40 hours a week. My job has me walking 14,000 steps a day, and I have a fused ankle on my right leg. I need good circulation, and this product gives me that. If I don’t keep the blood flowing to the ankle then I’m in tremendous pain. Thanks to your product, I can still do my job. I don’t know how to say thanks but I will keep buying these, I can tell you that. P.S. This product is very durable as well!
customer_reviews.author: Celeste R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Sport compression socks
customer_reviews.text: Aft my achilles injury n surgery i needed something to help support n also to prevent futher injury. N these really help in all areas! They look just like in pic n how its described! They have helped me through out the day @ gym n work n feels great on! Getting more for sure! Also a side note; i had ordered the calf sleeves @ first but due to injury i could not use them n needed to return n change to these socks, the seller were AWESOME(!!!) n even let me keep the sleeves n gave me refund to re-buy the socks instead!! Best customer support by far!! Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: love hellokitty

customer_reviews.title: Definitely work well for me
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered some time ago one pair and they worked very good, so I ordered another pair (also to be able to use, when the other pair is drying after washing...) later. I'm using all the time, also when napping, but not when sleeping during the night. I've noticed that even some minor pain that I had in my lower legs before, is now gone. I have used other similar socks (so-called travelers' socks") for several years (and still have many pairs of them), but switched over to these completely, because these are much better.
customer_reviews.author: SOR

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and performance
customer_reviews.text: I have had problems recovering from a knee replacement. Several screws and plates were also removed from my tibia from a previous surgery after an accident. These compression stockings are easier to put on if you'll just follow the instructions. I can wear them all day without any complaint from my legs. Even my operative knee feels better with these stockings, even if they don't cover the joint. I can also vouch for the Blitzu bike lighting products. I did not realize the same company makes both type of products, but I will pay more attention whenever I see a Blitzu product offering in the future!
customer_reviews.author: DONALD PHELPS

customer_reviews.title: Quality Compression Socks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a couple of different brands to try. One brand is much cheaper, thinner. The BLITZU are quality socks that really do feel like athletic socks.They seem really well made. The price reflects this but you do get what you pay for. As far as washing, my first pair accidentally went into the dryer and may have shrunk just a tad but still wearable. Now they go in the a lingerie bag and air dry. Too bad the colors are 5 dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: shelle Turner

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t fit
customer_reviews.text: These got high reviews. I ordered them because I had Achilles’ tendon surgery and needed to get the edema out from my leg, they are a very nice quality I ordered large extra large, I have a size 13 foot extra wide and I could not get them over my foot, my wife tried putting them on foot the two of us pushing and pulling and no way, my wife is foot size 8 and 120 lb. they fit her very nicely although she doesn’t need Compression socks she now has a very nice pair. Point is if your on the larger side like me 6 foot 250. They won’t fit. Get ones using measurements
customer_reviews.author: Frak Lake

customer_reviews.title: but it's not too bad if you follow the directions
customer_reviews.text: I wear these when I end up sitting at my desk for a long time working. The first time, they're a little difficult to put on, but it's not too bad if you follow the directions. I like the gray stripes that act like Kinesthetic tape, it makes for a more comfortable fit. They're not super warm. I have slept with them on before (forgot to take off) and it felt fine except for the imprints in the skin--because you're not supposed to wear them for that long! Oops.
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: These Actually Work
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never worn compression socks, and I didn’t really have the full information on what they were about, so I did some research. I decided to get them because they promote better circulation in your legs and feet, relieve pressure and pain, and help with movement as well. I’m a nurse and I’m on my feet most of the day as well as suffer from sciatica and nerve damage on my left side from a car accident. These socks work. Hands down. Don’t be discouraged because they’re a little tricky to get on at first and seem tight. But, that’s what they’re meant to feel like and you will be able to feel the benefits if they’re right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Irv226

customer_reviews.title: These are great. Now no swelling or numbness
customer_reviews.text: Had back surgery this year. Some nerve/muscle damage in calves and had trouble in PT with ankle swelling because not getting enough muscle activity while nerves recover. These are great. Now no swelling or numbness. Also, they are graduated and do not choke the top of your calves (or leave deep depressions in your skin whyem you pull them off), unlike some others. Tried one pair. Wore for two days and order 5 more. I wear size 13 men's shoe. Large/xl fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Lone WOlf

customer_reviews.title: Postpartum Edema
customer_reviews.text: I had horrible edema all over my body literally after birth. My feet were so swollen they started to crack (no exaggeration) 2 days of putting on these socks and my legs were back to normal! Now it was not easy at all!!!! To put on it hurt and was so tight. You think it won't go up but it will. I scrunched them up as much as I could slid them on as far as I could then I just pulled and pulled and pulled on the sock up my leg. The way they instruct you to do it on the directions didn't work for me. Other than that these socks are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: WalkingDiary

customer_reviews.title: ... my mom after she had surgery and they are excellent. She said they are comfortable and she loves ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my mom after she had surgery and they are excellent. She said they are comfortable and she loves the colors. Blitzu has great customer service. They sent me an e-mail to make sure I was 100% satisfied with the purchase following delivery and provided contact information in case I had any questions or concerns. They even provided helpful suggestions for making the socks easier to put on and take off. Would definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Greene

customer_reviews.title: Best that I have used! They work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Best of the five that I have tested. They out perform the very expensive Brand from my Local Medical supplier. Fit and finish are great. They function as designed. My feet and legs stopped swelling. The Kinesiology technology is the big difference. They are much easier to put on and are labeled right and left! I was able to stop the water pills. Forget the rest, buy the best. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RWW

customer_reviews.title: I would like to give this a 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I would like to give this a 5 star ,because it actually does work. I had a compound leg fracture and the socks really help with the swelling and the discomfort that I would feel from time to time. I am on my feet a lot so I needed relief and the socks do everything as described. However I have had them now for about 2 month and the durability was disappointing ,they ripped at the top. Not happy about. I was getting ready to order a few more ,but have to reconsider.
customer_reviews.author: Boss dawg

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! These are great! I'm overweight and stand ALL day at work. I tried these on (wait for the directions on how to put them on to arrive in your email) and my legs immediately felt better. These are extremely tight. I bought them for a bit of travel I have coming up bc some travel websites recommended compression socks to protect your legs. I think I will wear them around locally to get used them but I'm looking forward to invigorated legs!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Porche

customer_reviews.title: Great design and comfortable once on
customer_reviews.text: Great design and comfortable once on! Right after purchase customer service sends pdf file instructions of how to put the socks on correctly. Without it, due to the compression element, the socks would be very difficult to put on! Socks themselves are great quality with good compression. Bought these to wear on flight for sprained ankle together with foot brace. They werent able to prevent any swelling, but definately performed enough to minimise the swelling. Still great product / price!
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Good socks for running at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these socks for running. I have trouble with shin splints. These socks seem to help. I used to wear compression socks only for long runs, now I wear them for the 6 milers as well. I've worn these only 2x so far, but they seem to work as well as socks that I paid double the price for. So I would say these are great value.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews, I decided to try these. Glad I did. And, I agree you should definitely read included instructions on how to put them on. My doctor recommended using compression socks due to severe swelling of feet. Shortly after putting these socks on, I could visibly see and feel a difference. Swelling reduced considerably. I'm going to give this a bit more time but hoping to come back with a 5 star. My feet had swollen from a size 8 to an11.5. I did order the L/XL. Happy with size selection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your buying more than great compression socks, this little company is a fanatic about health and exercise!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for these socks then like me you have issues with pain and health. The booklet that comes with these compression socks is worth three doctor visits alone. What to eat, exercise and help prevent problems getting worse is all in this guide. I feel like I’m in good hands when using their products. And I’m a real skeptic, and no I’m not being paid or given any gifts to influence me. I’m just proud to find a little company that deserves attention.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: the best of the bunch
customer_reviews.text: I'll be quick. I started to see some lower-leg edema, and knew compression stockings would help. I got a plain white pair from CVS: $44, and thin. I then bought three pairs here on Amazon. These are, by FAR, the best of the bunch. Well made, comfortable, they seem to breathe better than the others. My wife says the purple looks pink but ah...what does she know. These are the ones to get.
customer_reviews.author: Droopus

customer_reviews.title: They were amazing! I had no swelling at all
customer_reviews.text: When we traveled to Thailand earlier in the year, I had so much swelling in my feet and calves, which I had never experienced before. I was very worried before our trip to France, so I ordered these on a whim based on the reviews. They were amazing! I had no swelling at all. They were comfortable and didn't dig in at all, unlike other compression socks. They were very breathable. I will be wearing these on any lengthy flights from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey B. Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: I have found the graduated compression socks purchased at Walgreens to work better but they are also much more expensive at $40 ...
customer_reviews.text: These are too tight for me and get uncomfortable in a couple of hours. They are nearly impossible for me to put on as well but I have had a couple of back surgeries so normal socks can be a bit difficult. I have found the graduated compression socks purchased at Walgreens to work better but they are also much more expensive at $40 per pair.
customer_reviews.author: Delbert T. Mcroberts

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks - they do the job I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Good fitting socks (ordered large).... I have been encountering sharp cramps in my legs and feet while sleeping at night. I've tried some "foaming creams" (helps a little). But since I've been wearing the compression socks, I've not had a single cramp (2 weeks now). I wear them during the day (office desk job) and they provide some nice firm support. I also wear them to bed but take them off after 3 or 4 hours since I don't like wearing socks during sleep. Apparently, a few hours in bed and that's all I need to prevent leg cramps.... highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MAS in SC

customer_reviews.title: Kinesio tape and compression in a sock
customer_reviews.text: The closest thing to Kinesio tape you'll find in a sock. I purchased 5 different types of compression socks for my chronic Achilles tendinitis I never had much faith in the tape, but these socks gave compression plus the benefits(if any) of the tape. And, I must say, I think they kinda help! So, the socks offer very good compression and seem to stimulate th e blood flow through the cross-stitching. All the pairs of socks I bought, these seemed to be the best.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit! Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to order another pair! As a nurse who is on her feet for 12 hour shifts, I can appreciate a good supportive pair of socks and these are perfect for me! I have an average size leg, not skinny but not big, just a full size calf and I was worried they might be too tight but they are not! I also like this purple/pink color. It says to hand wash. Not a big problem considering how nicely they fit! Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: The socks I purchased were not as described—the sizing is WAY off (too small). I purchased the L/XL size compression socks in pink, thinking I was buying them a little big for added comfort, and these wouldn’t even go up my forearm. So, unless you are buying for a L/XL toddler, I would steer clear of this product. It’s a shame because the fabric is nice and thick, and the color is very similar to the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy T.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality/ get the XL
customer_reviews.text: Product came when it was expected and works good, seem to be of a very good quality and are definitely helping with hematoma/ leg swelling after having a beam crush my calf muscles tearing them and giving me a DVT. Only negative I can see is they are very tight, I’m 5’7” and 175 with and athletic build with a size 11W shoe. I got the extra large and I’m glad I did as I can’t imagine being much bigger than myself and getting them on, my calf atrophied all the way down to 14 1/2 inches so if you fall in those parameters you are getting a great product!
customer_reviews.author: andrew b.

customer_reviews.title: Pure comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. I work average of 10-12 hour days also with 2.5 hour of commute time. Legs/feet felt great all day . I am almost 60 so in keeping 15K+ steps a day, many on an extension ladder, it is nice to not have my dogs and legs ache at the end of the day. Great product. Would like you all to figure out how they can be machined washed. Don't mind hanging them up to dry but hand washing..... I do have a washer that does not have an agitator so am going to wash them and see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: lester agnew

customer_reviews.title: Great compression socks
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing compression socks at a great value. They really help me get through long 12 hour shifts on my feet. I have noticed a huge difference in my fatigue at the end of shift since switching to these. I also really like the pink color. My only complaint with these socks is that the package they come in advises to hand wash them which is kind of a pain.
customer_reviews.author: misschim

customer_reviews.title: Friends in the nursing field all feel this sock is amazing and are looking at purchasing themselves
customer_reviews.text: In recovery for an ankle fracture, I needed something for swelling and support. This sock absolutely fit the bill. I have not had any swelling since I started wearing the socks. I also feel the ankle support helped to increase my confidence to work at increasing flexibility and stability of my foot. Friends in the nursing field all feel this sock is amazing and are looking at purchasing themselves. They are worth every penny... I also do extreme fitness and could continue a modified workout with this sock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too smal...size chart not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: The socks are way too small, my legs ached the on the entire plane trip to Israel. I purchased the small/medium according to your chart, I am a size 8.5-9 shoe and my calf size is 16". On the way back home I could not bare to continue to wear these I had to remove them a 1/4 of the way into the flight. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Go to socks
customer_reviews.text: I received my socks 3 days ago, could not wait to try them out. They are absolutely the best compression socks that I have in my arsenal. I work in the hot oilfield, I was worried that they would be too hot for the Oklahoma summer days. I was wrong. Kept my feet and legs cool and dry. The upper elastic band is not so tight to leave dents on my calf. I will purchase a pair for my RN wife, my son who also works in the west Texas oilfield, and another pair for myself. Love them 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: DYarb

customer_reviews.title: Best compression socks I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing compression socks for more than 10 year. I have purchased many different brands, but to date these "BLITZ" compression sock are hands down the finest brand I have tried. Only complaint I have is that I have to hand wash them, would love to just toss them into the washing machine. But as for comfort, and support, there is no better brand out there, or at least none that I have found yet.
customer_reviews.author: J. LaPlume

product_meta.title: BLITZU Compression Socks 20-30mmHg for Men Women Running Travel Nurses Recovery
feature_bullets: ✔ COMPRESSION THERAPY TECHNOLOGY - Provides true graduated compression to promote blood circulation and oxygen flow, prevent cramping, fatigue, swelling, help muscle recovery, spider, varicose veins and diabetic. Use them on a plane during that 9 hr flights or during that 6 mile walk. Your durable (20 - 30 mmHg) socks work with your routine. Feel the shock absorption effect instantly that really helps reduce fatigue and swelling in your lower leg!

✔ BLITZU KINESIOLOGY TAPING DESIGN - The One-of-a-Kind compression socks that combine the stability of kinesiology taping with the performance of compression fabric. Perfect for Relief of varicose veins or other leg swelling issues. Support your foot, heel, arch, ankle, and calf. Use it every day, night, or both. Prevent blood clots after surgery and Fits well unlike other Dr. prescribed Stiff varieties. The toe area won’t squeeze your aching toe joints. Instant comfort & support GUARANTEE!

✔ DESIGNED FOR EVERYDAY USE AND OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES - Bring more energy into your feet. It's perfect for jobs that require you to be on your feet a lot. It's also a must have for any leg intensive activity such as Marathon, Running, Hiking, Gym Fitness Training, Basketball, Cycling, Weightlifting and more. Perfect for extreme races and long runs!

✔ PROFESSIONAL HIGH GRADE QUALITY - Made of Power+ Premium Performance Fabric. A must have for men, women and elder at any age. The superior grade circular knit structure delivers 360-degree stretch for greater flexibility and durability. Stay put Cuffs & Soothing feeling at the bottom and sides of foot, with no pinching. Sleek, stylish, fashionable design with many colors available.

✔ BUY IT NOW AND FEEL THE DIFFERENCE INSTANTLY - 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE- Your satisfaction is our guarantee! We Promise These Are The Most Perfect Fitting, Maximum Swelling Reducing, Highest Pain Relieving, Longest Lasting Compression Socks You Will Ever Own. If you don't absolutely love your compression socks for any reason, let us know and we'll refund your money back or send you a replacement! That is how confident we are that you will LOVE it!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
